net.sf.mmm.persistence.api

Interface PersistenceManager

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    RevisionedPersistenceManager
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractPersistenceManager, AbstractRevisionedPersistenceManager, PersistenceManagerImplJpa

    @ComponentSpecification
public interface PersistenceManager
    This is the interface for a manager of the persistence layer. It is the entrance point to the persistence component. In a common environment there is typically only one single instance of this interface active.
    The PersistenceManager acts as delegation to the GenericDao responsible for the according GenericEntity in the invoked methods. This guarantees that individual custom logic is also invoked in case of generic access.
    NOTE:
    You will have to perform operations of this persistence-layer in a transactional context. The suggested way is to use TransactionExecutor.
    Author:
    Joerg Hohwiller (hohwille at users.sourceforge.net)
    See Also:
    EntityManager

    • Method Detail

      • hasDao

        boolean hasDao(Class<? extends GenericEntity<?>> entityClass)
        This method determines if the DAO for the given entityClass is available. This can be useful to prevent exceptions.
        Parameters:
        entityClass - is the type of the GenericEntity for which the according GenericDao is requested.
        Returns:
        true if getDao(Class) will return a valid DAO for the given entityClass, false otherwise (if an exception would be thrown).

      • getDao

        <ID,ENTITY extends GenericEntity<ID>> GenericDao<ID,ENTITY> getDao(Class<ENTITY> entityClass)
                                                            throws ObjectNotFoundException
        This method gets the individual GenericDao responsible for the given entityClass.
        Type Parameters:
        ENTITY - is the generic entity-type.
        ID - is the type of the primary key.
        Parameters:
        entityClass - is the type of the GenericEntity for which the according GenericDao is requested.
        Returns:
        the GenericDao responsible for the given entityClass.
        Throws:
        ObjectNotFoundException - if the requested DAO could NOT be found.

      • find

        <ID,ENTITY extends GenericEntity<ID>> ENTITY find(Class<ENTITY> entityClass,
                                                  ID id)
                                           throws ObjectNotFoundException
        This method loads the GenericEntity with the given entityClass and id from the persistent store.
        Type Parameters:
        ENTITY - is the generic type of the entityClass.
        ID - is the type of the primary key.
        Parameters:
        entityClass - is the class reflecting the type of the requested entity.
        id - is the primary key of the requested entity.
        Returns:
        the requested entity.
        Throws:
        ObjectNotFoundException - if the requested entity could NOT be found.
        See Also:
        GenericDao.find(Object)

      • findIfExists

        <ID,ENTITY extends GenericEntity<ID>> ENTITY findIfExists(Class<ENTITY> entityClass,
                                                          ID id)
        This method loads the GenericEntity with the given entityClass and id from the persistent store.
        Type Parameters:
        ENTITY - is the generic type of the entityClass.
        ID - is the type of the primary key.
        Parameters:
        entityClass - is the class reflecting the type of the requested entity.
        id - is the primary key of the requested entity.
        Returns:
        the requested entity or null if it does NOT exist.
        See Also:
        GenericDao.findIfExists(Object)

      • getReference

        <ID,ENTITY extends GenericEntity<ID>> ENTITY getReference(Class<ENTITY> entityClass,
                                                          ID id)
                                                   throws ObjectNotFoundException
        This method creates a lazy reference proxy of the GenericEntity with the given entityClass and id from the persistent store.
        Type Parameters:
        ID - is the type of the primary key.
        ENTITY - is the generic type of the entityClass.
        Parameters:
        entityClass - is the class reflecting the type of the requested entity.
        id - is the primary key of the requested entity.
        Returns:
        the requested entity.
        Throws:
        ObjectNotFoundException - if the requested entity could NOT be found.
        See Also:
        GenericDao.getReference(Object)

      • create

        <ID,ENTITY extends GenericEntity<ID>> ENTITY create(Class<ENTITY> entityClass)
        This method creates a new and transient instance for the given entityClass.
        Type Parameters:
        ID - is the type of the primary key.
        ENTITY - is the generic type of the entityClass.
        Parameters:
        entityClass - is the Class reflecting the entity to create. This may also be the interface of the entity.
        Returns:
        the new instance.
        See Also:
        GenericDao.create()

      • save

        void save(GenericEntity<?> entity)
        This method saves the given entity.
        Parameters:
        entity - is the entity to save.
        See Also:
        GenericDao.save(GenericEntity)

      • delete

        void delete(GenericEntity<?> entity)
        This method deletes the given entity.
        Parameters:
        entity - is the entity to delete.
        See Also:
        GenericDao.delete(GenericEntity)

      • getEntityClass

        Class<? extends GenericEntity<?>> getEntityClass(GenericEntity<?> entity)
        This method gets the Class reflecting the given entity. Unlike entity.#getClass() this method will always return the real class defining the entity.
        The underlying JPA implementation may create a dynamic proxy or byte-code generated sub-class that extends the entity-class. In such case entity.#getClass() will return the Class of the proxy instead. In such case this method will return the real entity-class adapted by the proxy.
        Parameters:
        entity - is the GenericEntity for which the class is requested.
        Returns:
        the Class reflecting the given entity.
